literal_meaning: To be like a fish in water.
figurative_meaning: To feel comfortable or at ease in a situation.
example: When she started her new job, she was like a fish in water.

literal_meaning: To have butter on one's head.
figurative_meaning: To have a guilty conscience or to be hypocritical.
example: He criticizes others, but he has butter on his head himself.

idiom: Když ptáčka lapají, pěkně mu zpívají
literal_meaning: When they catch the bird, they sing nicely to it.
example: Be careful; when they want something from you, they will be nice. Když ptáčka lapají, pěkně mu zpívají.

figurative_meaning: To be careful about what you say.
example: You should give yourself a warning to watch your tongue during the meeting.

figurative_meaning: To hit rock bottom or face dire consequences.
example: If he continues this way, he will go to the bottom very soon.

idiom: Kdo se bojí, nesmí do lesa
literal_meaning: Who is afraid must not go into the forest.
figurative_meaning: If you're afraid to take risks, you won't achieve anything.
example: If you want to succeed, remember: kdo se bojí, nesmí do lesa.

literal_meaning: To have your head in the clouds.
figurative_meaning: To be daydreaming or not paying attention.
example: He has his head in the clouds and doesn't realize what's happening around him.

literal_meaning: To snow like from a kettle.
example: It was sněžit jako z konve all night long.
After getting the job offer, she was in seventh heaven.
